item.title: Refer to another person? p.absX?

@WRX wrote:

Ok, here goes, you will have to at least know the method for the player attacking the other player.

client p = (client) otherPName;

This may do it, if not. I’m sorry i tried =p
P.s, thats raw code so I’m sorry if i forgot anything…

item.title: Refer to another person? p.absX?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

How can I do that here? I’m trying to add pking but the problem is, people inside wilderness can attack people outside.

Here’s my code:

if ((absY >= 3524) && (absY <= 3592) && (absX >= 3041) && (absX <= 3400) || (absY >= 3530) && (absY <= 3950) && (absX >= 2959) && (absX <= 3312)) { //what do I add to make p work? if ((p.absY >= 3524) && (p.absY <= 3592) && (p.absX >= 3041) && (p.absX <= 3400) || (p.absY >= 3530) && (p.absY <= 3950) && (p.absX >= 2959) && (p.absX <= 3312)) { server.pking = true; } else { server.pking = false; } }

How can I make p.absY get your opponents coords? So if the opponent is in wilderness, you can attack, but if they aren’t you can’t.

Basically, how can I make p. work

OF COURSE

if you know a better way to make it so people can’t attack other people outside of wild, you can say that. I have Devolution v7

Read full topic
